conclusion: Analyze forces on the copper rod and use tension information.
The rod MN is suspended horizontally in a magnetic field directed into the paper.
Identify forces: gravitational force downward, magnetic force upward, tension in wires.
Express tensions: Tension is halved when rod is energized, magnetic force equals gravitational force.
Magnetic force on a conductor is given by F_B = BIL.
Solve for current I: I = mg/BL.
Determine current direction using right-hand rule: current flows from M to N.
